snippet: The Carlyle Group says it has taken a 55 percent stake in Vermillion Asset Management, a commodities hedge fund with about $2.2 billion in assets. Carlyle, which paid a mix of stock and cash, will make Vermillion its main commodities trading...
abstract: The Carlyle Group says it has taken a 55 percent stake in Vermillion Asset Management, a commodities hedge fund with about $2.2 billion in assets. Carlyle, which paid a mix of stock and cash, will make Vermillion its main commodities trading platform.

headline.main: Carlyle Buys Control of a Commodities Trader
